name: Nina's Russian Cold Beet Soup (Kholdnyk)
author: Nina Capaccio
summary: Super easy and absolutely great version of the longer and original recipe for this soup that my grandmother brought from Russia. On a hot summer day, a bowl of this soup is an energizing lift.  Add a piece of of rye or pumpernickel bread served on the side to complete the Russian experience.
ingredients: 1  cucumber - peeled, seeded, quartered lengthwise and diced
1 (15 ounce) can sliced beets with liquid
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
2 tablespoons white vinegar, or to taste
directions: Mix the buttermilk, cucumber, beets with their juice, green onions, dill, salt, and vinegar in a bowl; stir to mix thoroughly, and chill, covered, in refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor
